item.description:
This only meetup in Boston that brings together nonprofits and businesses to work on collaboration and partnerships in an informative and fun format. We will be having a short presentation followed by discussion on how it can benefit your organization. Every month we bring one local nonprofit into the spotlight and all the donations go directly to the organization. The spotlight nonprofit will be Duplessy Foundation (http://www.duplessy.o...) for our next meetup. Vlora has also provided a special menu for the group. We kindly ask that you purchase something to eat small or large for lunch. Look forward to seeing you there!

Agenda:

12:00-12:15pm - Networking with food and drink
12:15-1:45pm - Short introductions, monthly nonprofit spotlight presentation http://www.duplessy.o..., followed by a presentation on fundraisering and development by Rick Blain of Richard Blain & Associaties (http://www.rrblain.co...)
1:45-2pm - More Networking and collaborating

More on Rick Blain and his presentation "Fundraising in a down economy":

In this session Rick Blain, a Certified Fund Raising Executive will lead us through a review of giving trends over the past 40 years, and discuss what makes this year different. We will explore what motivates people to give and discuss successful strategies to secure essential support today, while appropriately positioning our organizations to take advantage of the better times that are to come.

I'm excited to be hosting Rick who is Principal of Richard R. Blain & Associates, LLC located in North Andover, as our guest speaker. Rick has almost thirty years of professional experience, including approximately twenty five years as a consultant to not-for-profit institutions and organizations of various types and sizes. Rick currently serves on a number of not-for-profit Boards including the North Andover Scholarship Foundation, Family Service, Exchange Club of Lawrence, and the Essex County Community Foundation Grants Management Committee.

2009 Testimonials:
http://www.youtube.co...

“I met some great people who were willing to share ideas and thoughts. Everyone wants to help - it really is a win/win situation. ” - Danielle

“A good group of experienced professionals with diversified expertise but one thing in common: enthusiasm for social changes. Clear agenda, well organized meeting. People are genuinely willing to help each other. I can see great ideas forming and real collaborations happening. ” - Jing


PS. Remember to bring your own name tag this will help brand your organization more effectively.

Sponsors of the event:

The Nonprofit Career Coach a division of Jobs In Nonprofits (http://www.thenonprof...) and Vlora Restaurant (www.vloraboston.com)
item.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing a name tag - Bring your own name tag please!

group.name: Social Impact Success Community Meetup Group
